meanings.definition: To exert force on (someone or something) in order to move them away from oneself.
meanings.sent1: I push the door to open it.
meanings.sent2: She pushes the swing to make it go higher.
meanings.sent3: The cat tries to push the mouse away from its food.
meanings.sent4: His words push me to work harder.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind pushes the leaves across the yard.

meanings.definition: To move forward by using physical force.
meanings.sent1: The car can push through the deep snow.
meanings.sent2: We push against the heavy door to enter the room.
meanings.sent3: The little boy pretends to push a big truck uphill.
meanings.sent4: Her determination can push her through any challenge.
meanings.sent5: The river's current can push a boat downstream.

meanings.definition: An act of exerting force on someone or something in order to move them away from oneself.
meanings.sent1: With a strong push, he moved the heavy box.
meanings.sent2: She gave the door a gentle push to close it.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy gives a friendly push to get attention.
meanings.sent4: A push from behind startled her in the crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The push of the crowd made it hard to move forward.
